meanings.definition: A person who scratches or claws at something.
meanings.sent1: The scrabblers in the movie were trying to escape from the locked room.
meanings.sent2: The cat was a skilled scrabblers, always leaving marks on the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The little dog thought it was a scrabblers, trying to dig up buried treasure in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The scrabblers of the forest, the raccoons, left their mark on the trash cans every night.
meanings.sent5: The scrabblers in the sand were the crabs, leaving intricate patterns behind.

meanings.definition: A tool used for scraping or scratching.
meanings.sent1: She used the scrabblers to remove the old paint from the wall.
meanings.sent2: The gardener's favorite scrabblers was the hand rake for loosening soil.
meanings.sent3: The scrabblers slipped from his hand and left a long scratch on the table.
meanings.sent4: The scrabblers of the artist, the palette knife, created beautiful textures on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The scrabblers in the toolbox were essential for the carpenter's work.

meanings.definition: A game involving forming words from letter tiles.
meanings.sent1: The family gathered around the table to play scrabblers after dinner.
meanings.sent2: She always wins at scrabblers because she knows all the tricky words.
meanings.sent3: The scrabblers tournament had players from all over the country competing for the top prize.
meanings.sent4: In the world of board games, scrabblers is a classic that never gets old.
meanings.sent5: The children enjoyed playing scrabblers, learning new words while having fun.
